SETS.LaTeX: \text{Let } I \text{ be the set of warehouses (NY, LA, CH, ATL)}; \text{ let } R \text{ be the set of regions (1, 2, 3)}

VARIABLES.name: y_NY
VARIABLES.description: 1 if New York warehouse is opened, 0 otherwise

VARIABLES.name: y_LA
VARIABLES.description: 1 if Los Angeles warehouse is opened, 0 otherwise

VARIABLES.name: y_CH
VARIABLES.description: 1 if Chicago warehouse is opened, 0 otherwise

VARIABLES.name: y_ATL
VARIABLES.description: 1 if Atlanta warehouse is opened, 0 otherwise

VARIABLES.name: x_NY
VARIABLES.description: Number of units shipped from New York warehouse

VARIABLES.name: x_LA
VARIABLES.description: Number of units shipped from Los Angeles warehouse

VARIABLES.name: x_CH
VARIABLES.description: Number of units shipped from Chicago warehouse

VARIABLES.name: x_ATL
VARIABLES.description: Number of units shipped from Atlanta warehouse

PARAMETERS.name: p_Name
PARAMETERS.description: Each warehouse can ship 100 units per week

PARAMETERS.name: Fixed_Cost_NY
PARAMETERS.description: Weekly fixed cost of keeping New York warehouse open

PARAMETERS.name: Fixed_Cost_LA
PARAMETERS.description: Weekly fixed cost of keeping Los Angeles warehouse open

PARAMETERS.name: Fixed_Cost_CH
PARAMETERS.description: Weekly fixed cost of keeping Chicago warehouse open

PARAMETERS.name: Fixed_Cost_ATL
PARAMETERS.description: Weekly fixed cost of keeping Atlanta warehouse open

PARAMETERS.name: Cost_NY_to_Region_1
PARAMETERS.description: Cost of sending one unit from New York to Region 1

PARAMETERS.name: Cost_NY_to_Region_2
PARAMETERS.description: Cost of sending one unit from New York to Region 2
